verses.text_plain: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!
verses.verse_html:
1Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city! ▼
▼ her…: or, gluttonous: Heb. craw

footnotes.body_html: ▼ her…: or, gluttonous: Heb. craw

verses.text_plain: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the Lord; she drew not near to her God.
verses.verse_html:
2She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the Lord; she drew not near to her God. ▼
▼ correction: or, instruction

verses.text_plain: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.
verses.verse_html: 3Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.

verses.text_plain: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.
verses.verse_html: 4Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.

verses.text_plain: The just Lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.
verses.verse_html:
5The just Lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame. ▼
▼ every…: Heb. morning by morning

footnotes.body_html: ▼ every…: Heb. morning by morning

verses.text_plain: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.
verses.verse_html:
6I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant. ▼
▼ towers: or, corners

tokens.text: so that there is no man

verses.text_plain: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.
verses.verse_html: 7I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.

verses.text_plain: Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the Lord, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
verses.verse_html: 8Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the Lord, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

verses.text_plain: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the Lord, to serve him with one consent.
verses.verse_html:
9For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the Lord, to serve him with one consent. ▼
▼ language: Heb. lip
 , ▼
▼ consent: Heb. shoulder

verses.text_plain: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.
verses.verse_html: 10From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

verses.text_plain: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.
verses.verse_html:
11In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain. ▼
▼ because…: Heb. in my holy

tokens.text: against me: for then I will take away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ because…: Heb. in my holy

verses.text_plain: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 12I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
verses.verse_html: 13The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

verses.text_plain: Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 14Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: The Lord hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the Lord, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.
verses.verse_html: 15The Lord hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the Lord, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.

tokens.text: of thee: thou shalt not see

verses.text_plain: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
verses.verse_html:
16In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack. ▼
▼ slack: or, faint

verses.text_plain: The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
verses.verse_html:
17The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing. ▼
▼ rest: Heb. be silent

footnotes.body_html: ▼ rest: Heb. be silent

verses.text_plain: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.
verses.verse_html:
18I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden. ▼
▼ reproach…: Heb. the burden upon it was reproach

footnotes.body_text: ▼ reproach…: Heb. the burden upon it was reproach
footnotes.body_html: ▼ reproach…: Heb. the burden upon it was reproach

verses.text_plain: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.
verses.verse_html:
19Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame. ▼
▼ get…: Heb. set them for a praise
 , ▼
▼ where…: Heb. of their shame

tokens.text: where they have been put to shame

footnotes.body_text: ▼ get…: Heb. set them for a praise
footnotes.body_html: ▼ get…: Heb. set them for a praise
▼ where…: Heb. of their shame

verses.text_plain: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 20At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.
